1552788873_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: New Zealand might not want the video shared. But whoever New Zealand's enemies are... yeah, they'll make sure the video's out there. Maybe not on regular internet, but definitely on Zeronet.

> [quantumkitty](#comment_205_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): The real problem is that Brenton Tarrant is smiling away and making neo-nazi gestures in a comfy prison cell, while here we are arguing over whether some teenagers sharing a violent video on the internet should get 10 years in prison.

I'm definitely happy with being able to leave my room, go get some food at any number of restaurants, relax in the park, walk my dog, and explore the world, something Tarrant can't do.

> [quantumkitty](#comment_206_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): Unlikely that a mass murderer's mind would ever care about any of these things. [...]

Don't we also win for having the freedom to do the things I mentioned? It certainly feels like winning to me.

> [quantumkitty](#comment_212_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): It's good to have freedom.Â Then again, now I have to be scared of being randomly gunned down every time I go and do my groceries at the mall.

Part and parcel.
